column1: Musan County is a county in central North Hamgyong province
column2: North Korea. It borders the People's Republic of China to the north
column3: across the Tumen River.  It is divided into one ŭp
column5: and fifteen ri. The county seat is the town of Musan
column6: Musan ŭp. Luguo and Dehua are the closest Chinese cities across the river.

column1: The land of Musan is high and more than 90% is mountainous and uninhabited; much of it lies on the Paekmu Plateau
column2: while the northwest makes up part of the Musan Plateau.  The Hamgyong Mountains pass along the county's northwest flank. Musan is the coldest region in North Hamgyong.

column1: The Musan area has long been known for iron ore mines
column4: a major excavator of iron ore
column5: is located here. Because many of the trees have been cut down for fuel

column1: Individual farmers in Musan raise cows
column5: the government prohibits the people from using the cows for beef consumption. The cows are used for work only.

column2: including the Musan Line and Paengmu Line.

column1: Musan and the surrounding region was greatly affected by flooding in 2016 as the result of Typhoon Lionrock.
